proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: AC || IF, 3.14 = pi, G on BH, pi * (x / 180) = ∠IGE, ∠CBE, E on BH, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠ABD, ∠DGF, ∠EBA, ∠CBH, E on DG, ∠IGD, B on DG, ∠ABD, B on DH, B on AC, ∠HBA, pi * (y / 180) = ∠EGF, ∠DBC

Step 2:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : AC || IF
Conclusions: ∠DBC = ∠DGF, ∠HBA = ∠HGI

Step 3:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : AC || IF
Conclusions: ∠CBG = ∠IGB, ∠BGF = ∠GBA

Step 4:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 6.28 = 2 * pi

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CBH, G on BH
Conclusions: ∠CBG = ∠CBH

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CBH, E on BH
Conclusions: ∠CBE = ∠CBH

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on DG, ∠DGF
Conclusions: ∠DGF = ∠EGF

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on DG, ∠IGD
Conclusions: ∠IGD = ∠IGE

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on DG, ∠IGD
Conclusions: ∠IGB = ∠IGD

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on DG, ∠DGF
Conclusions: ∠BGF = ∠DGF

Step 11:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : B on DH, B on AC
Conclusions: ∠ABD = ∠CBH

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on BH, ∠HBA
Conclusions: ∠EBA = ∠HBA

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on BH, ∠HBA
Conclusions: ∠GBA = ∠HBA

Step 14:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠ABD, ∠EBA, ∠DBC, ∠CBE
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ABD + ∠CBE + ∠DBC + ∠EBA

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = ∠IGE, ∠IGD = ∠IGE
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = ∠IGD

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BGF = ∠DGF, ∠BGF = ∠GBA
Conclusions: ∠DGF = ∠GBA

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EBA = ∠HBA, ∠HBA = ∠HGI
Conclusions: ∠EBA = ∠HGI

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠ABD + ∠CBE + ∠DBC + ∠EBA, 6.28 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 6.28 = ∠ABD + ∠CBE + ∠DBC + ∠EBA

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IGB = ∠IGD, pi * (x / 180) = ∠IGD
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = ∠IGB

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DGF = ∠GBA, pi * (y / 180) = ∠EGF, ∠DGF = ∠EGF
Conclusions: pi * (y / 180) = ∠GBA

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBG = ∠IGB, pi * (x / 180) = ∠IGB
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBG

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (y / 180) = ∠GBA, ∠GBA = ∠HBA, ∠HBA = ∠HGI
Conclusions: pi * (y / 180) = ∠HGI

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DGF = ∠GBA, pi * (y / 180) = ∠GBA
Conclusions: pi * (y / 180) = ∠DGF

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBG, ∠CBG = ∠CBH
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBH

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EBA = ∠HGI, pi * (y / 180) = ∠HGI
Conclusions: pi * (y / 180) = ∠EBA

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (y / 180) = ∠DGF, ∠DBC = ∠DGF
Conclusions: pi * (y / 180) = ∠DBC

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ABD = ∠CBH, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠ABD, pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBH
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBH, ∠CBE = ∠CBH
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBE

Step 29:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * (y / 180) = ∠DBC, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * (y / 180) = ∠DBC

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = pi * ((3 * y) / 180), pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠ABD
Conclusions: pi * (x / 180) = ∠ABD

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (y / 180) = ∠DBC, 3.14 * (y / 180) = ∠DBC
Conclusions: 3.14 * (y / 180) = pi * (y / 180)

Step 32:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = ∠ABD, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * (x / 180) = ∠ABD

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * (y / 180) = pi * (y / 180), pi * (y / 180) = ∠EBA
Conclusions: 3.14 * (y / 180) = ∠EBA

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = ∠ABD, 3.14 * (x / 180) = ∠ABD
Conclusions: 3.14 * (x / 180) = pi * (x / 180)

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (x / 180) = ∠CBE, 3.14 * (x / 180) = pi * (x / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * (x / 180) = ∠CBE

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * (x / 180) = pi * (x / 180), pi * (x / 180) = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * (x / 180) = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)

Step 37:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 3.14 * (x / 180) = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * (x / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * y) / 180)

Step 38:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 * (x / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * y) / 180), 6.28 = ∠ABD + ∠CBE + ∠DBC + ∠EBA, 3.14 * (y / 180) = ∠DBC, 3.14 * (y / 180) = ∠EBA, 3.14 * (x / 180) = ∠CBE, 3.14 * (x / 180) = ∠ABD
Conclusions: 135 = x
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(A, B, D)), Mul(pi, Div(Mul(3.0, y), 180.0)))
